Posts.Content: snufflesmom wrote: Well after years of thyroid issues, it is my turn to have the thyroid out.  They will not biopsy it first, there are way to many nodules both hot and cold on it.  It has grown since radiation.  I would be willing to be it is cancerous.  I'm not worried since it is so cureable.  My question is, how long is the recovery?  How long were you in the hospital.  How many of you did have your thyroid out?  Did it turn out to be cancer? Posts.Title: Thyroid Cancer snufflesmom Shirl

Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2008 11:44AM snufflesmom wrote: Pam, oh man can I relate to your son and the docs not knowing what was wrong.  I kept going to the doc, but all they did was check the thyroid level.  Know who told me first that something was wrong with my  neck.............A fortune teller I kid you not.  He said I see someting wrong with your neck but it is not cancer.  About a year later a ENT found it. I've taken levoxyl since 96 or 97,  with Hashimotos' it is not really the TSH hormone that is going up and down, your thyroid is destroying it self,  ( you son must have had a large amount of antiboides, that is how the disease is detected) and causing it so sometime go hypo or hyper, I just had tsh test done over the years and it has been pretty managable.  No real issue.  After BC I knew I had to deal with it again.  When the doc did my body scan to see if my BC was any where else in the body they said my thyroid was lite up.  So time to take it out, no need for it. I'm ready to have it done.  I hope it is B9 but if not, I beat BC I can beat TC. I wish your son well. Randi
